contentrichtext.text: {{unsourced|date=January 2009}} {{Chinese |title=Yan Yu |t=嚴輿 |s=严舆 }} {{chinese-name|[[Yan (surname)|Yan]]}} '''Yan Yu''' (died 196) was the younger brother of [[Yan Baihu]], a warlord during the late [[Han Dynasty]] period of [[History of China|Chinese history]]. Yan Yu was an envoy for peace when Yan Baihu was attacked by [[Sun Ce]]. During negotiations he proposed the division of [[Jiangdong]] but was killed by Sun Ce in fury. He was well known and respected as a fierce warrior. ==Fighting against Sun Ce== {{see also|Sun Ce's conquests in Jiangdong}} After Sun Ce defeated [[Liu Yao (warlord)|Liu Yao]], Inspector of Yang Province, he led an army against Wu Commandery. Yan Yu was sent to Maple Bridge to half Sun Ce's progress. Yan Yu's position was not held very long, he retreated into Wu after a short fight. Sun Ce's forces surrounded the city and began a siege. On the third day, Yan Baihu decided to sue for peace and sent Yan Yu as an ambassador. Yan Yu was executed when he proposed dividing Jiangdong between the two warlords. Sun Ce sent Yan Yu's head back to Yan Baihu. ==See also== *[[List of people of the Three Kingdoms]] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Yan, Yu | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Chinese warlord | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 196 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yan, Yu}} [[Category:Han Dynasty people related to the Three Kingdoms]] [[Category:2nd-century births]] [[Category:196 deaths]] [[Category:People from Huzhou]] {{China-bio-stub}}
